content.description: New route that was missing the first two bolts but were predrilled. I filled the holes, sorry if I screwed up your FA, I had the bolts so figured I'd use them. Fun route!
content.protection: 8 or so bolts to a Mussy Anchor
content.location: To the right of Turkey Trot and to the Left of another new route called Dr. Pitons Shagadelic 3-D House of Belay Slaves

content.description: Fun climb for the grade.  This is currently the 2nd route from the left on the main face.  Climb up past 3 bolts to gain a small ledge, then continue up past a few more bolts to a double ring anchor.
content.location: Currently the 2nd route from the left.

content.description: Start on the far left side of the wall.  Move up low angle terrain towards an arete below a small roof.  Pull the roof and clip the anchor.
content.protection: Bolts, Mussy Hook anchor, lower off.
content.location: Start on a small ledge located 20 feet up and left from the start of Turkey Trot.

content.description: Thin and steep start leads up to a bulge about 30 feet off the ground. Pull the bulge and continue up and slightly right near the top.  Shares anchor with the route to the right.
content.protection: Bolts, Mussy hook anchor, lower off.  Shares anchor with the route to the right.
content.location: Steep and thin start leads to a small low angle section below a bulge.  Currently the hardest route on the Northeast side.

climbs.name: Jimmy Dean
climbs.fa: Jim Voss, Kaylee Voss, Reed Ames - Nov. 2016

content.description:
Great route that looks harder than it is.  Move up the middle of the slab on the right side of the main face.  Move up and left to pull the bulge, and continue moving up and left along the small ramp until you can pull right onto the face up higher.  The crux of the route is avoiding the bird poop near the top.

*There is currently a loose hold near the roof bulge halfway up the route, but is it not a crucial hold and can easily be avoided.  As with any new route, be cautious while climbing and belaying.
content.protection: Bolts, Mussy hook anchor, lower off.
content.location: Located near the middle of the main face.  This route has a high first bolt in the middle of the slab.

climbs.name: Jennie O
climbs.fa: Kaylee Voss, Jim Voss, Reed Ames - Nov. 2016

content.description: Steep start and fun climbing up an arete leads to a roof up higher.  Stem up to pull the roof and move up and left to a shared anchor with Jimmy Dean.
content.protection: Bolts, Mussy hook anchor, lower off.  Shared anchor with Jimmy Dean.
content.location: Steep and well featured start leads to a low angle arete, which leads to a roof up high.

content.description: Climbs up a few bulges to a shared anchor with the route to the left.  Currently the right most route on the Northeast face of the Thanksgiving cliff.
content.protection: Bolts, Mussy hook anchor, lower off. Shared anchor.
content.location: Located on the right side of the Northeast face.

content.description: Scramble up easy terrain to reach the first bolt about 30 off the ground.  Follow the bolt line that is close to the right facing corner.  Climb past a few bolts, and then pull up and left to follow more bolts on the left side of the chimney that splits the middle of the main face.
content.protection: Bolts, Mussy hook anchor, lower off.
content.location: Located near the middle of the main face.  Scramble up to a high first bolt on the slab next to the corner, cross over to the left side of the chimney near the 4th bolt.

content.description: Starts up a very small arch next to a hueco in the rock.  The pillar of the arch almost looks like a drumstick.  Move up the left side of the first two bolts and then pull out right onto the face. The upper bolts are more spaced out, but the climbing gets easier. If you climb directly in line with the first two bolts, the route might feel closer to a 10b.
content.location: Located around the right side of the main face of The Thanksgiving cliff.  Route faces Northwest and can get some late afternoon sun.

climbs.name: Dr Pitons shagadelic 3-D house of belay slaves
climbs.fa: Kurt Arend, Tiffany Arend, Pete Zabrok

content.description: 11 bolts to an independent anchor with Mussy hooks. Fun safe climbing in the 5.9 range pulling over steep bulge at the end. Some dirt on the route from removing some loose blocks that were way too easy to remove and were right over the belay area for some of the routes, YIKES!! Need to go back with a brush.
content.protection: 11 bolts to a Mussy Hook anchor
content.location: The route begins to the left of Black Friday and to the right of another new route (missing the first two bolts that were pre drilled so I filled them with bolts).

content.description: Climb up and right at the start and then follow varied cracks up and left to a shared bolted anchor with Drumstick to What.
content.protection: Gear to 3", Bolted anchor.  Shares anchor with the sport route to the left.
content.location: Located on the Northwest side of Thanksgiving Cliff.  Hike around the right side of the main face and head uphill for about 40 feet.

climbs.name: Butterball
climbs.fa: TR - Reed Ames, Kyle Campbell - Nov. 2016

content.description:
Short, but thin and powerful moves on stellar rock.  There is a bolted anchor that you can easily set up a TR, after climbing either of the two routes to the left.

There are currently no lead bolts yet, so this is TR only for now.
content.location: Located on the right of the Northwest side of the cliff.

content.description: Climbs up undulating terrain with a thin crux on the first half of the route.  Make sure your belayer is paying attention, because you could possibly hit a ledge if you fall and there is too much rope out.
content.protection: Bolts, Mussy hook anchor, lower off.
content.location: This is currently the 3rd route from the left on the main face.
